title: Information Cascade at Group Scale

author: Milad Eftekhar, Department of Computer Science, University of Toronto

segmentation: Hi everyone, my name is Millard after heart from University of Toronto.
This talk is about information cascade at group scale and this is joint work with professorial.
Italian professor nekuda As all of you know, as all of us know, identifying the K most influential individuals is a well studied problem in our field of study.

The number of individuals that at the end will be convinced to adopt our product.
There are several advantages in this paradigm shift from influential individuals to influential groups.
The first one is that if the number of groups is smaller than the number of individuals, then we can get an improvement in performance and we can run the algorithm so faster.
The second thing is that these groups are actually natural targets for advertising it.

If we can identify the influential groups, then this information this information can be helpful for companies to to actually conduct more successful advertising campaigns, and the third advantage here is that targeting groups is an economical choice.
